Blue whale is the largest mammal on Earth.

Dolphins have a highly developed memory, especially for social relationships and acoustic signals. They can recognize the signature whistles of other dolphins theyâ€™ve encountered, even after being separated for over 20 years.

A well-known animal with large ears is the fennec fox. The fennec fox, native to the Sahara Desert and other parts of North Africa, is easily recognizable by its disproportionately large ears, which help it dissipate heat and locate prey underground. These adaptations are crucial for survival in the harsh desert environment.

The cheetah (Acinonyx jubatus) holds the title of the fastest land animal. Capable of reaching speeds up to 60 to 70 miles per hour (97 to 113 kilometers per hour) in short bursts covering distances up to 500 meters, the cheetah's acceleration is unmatched in the animal kingdom. This incredible speed is facilitated by its lightweight frame, long legs, and specialized muscle fibers. Cheetahs are primarily found in Africa, where they inhabit a variety of environments including savannas, grasslands, and arid regions.

The giraffe (Giraffa camelopardalis) is known for its long neck, which can reach up to 6 feet (1.8 meters) in length. This unique adaptation allows giraffes to browse on leaves and shoots high in the trees, giving them access to food sources that other herbivores cannot reach. The giraffe's long neck is supported by a complex system of muscles, blood vessels, and specialized vertebrae that enable it to reach high branches with ease.
The ostrich (Struthio camelus) holds the title of the largest bird in the world. Native to Africa, the ostrich is known for its impressive size

The hippopotamus (Hippopotamus amphibius) is a large herbivore found in Africa. Known for its massive size and semi-aquatic lifestyle, the hippo spends much of its time in rivers and lakes. Despite its bulky appearance, it is an agile swimmer and can move quickly on land as well. Hippos primarily feed on grasses and play a crucial role in their ecosystems by influencing the structure of vegetation near water bodies.
The donkey is a symbol of the Democratic Party in the USA.

A well-known animal often associated with peanuts is the monkey. Monkeys are frequently depicted in popular culture and entertainment as enjoying peanuts, and they are commonly fed peanuts in zoos and wildlife parks. This association has made monkeys a recognizable animal linked to peanuts in the public imagination.

The war horse is known for its role in ancient warfare. Horses have been used in battle for thousands of years, serving as mounts for soldiers and carrying them into combat. War horses were trained for battle and played a crucial role in cavalry charges, reconnaissance missions, and other military operations. Their strength, speed, and agility made them valuable assets on the battlefield.

Cat is often depicted in children's books and cartoons. Tom and Jerry is a famous cartoon series featuring a cat and a mouse, which is beloved by audiences of all ages. Cats are also popular characters in children's literature, with many stories featuring cats as protagonists or companions to human characters. Their playful and mischievous nature makes them endearing to readers and viewers alike.

The frilled shark (Chlamydoselachus anguineus) has a gestation period of nearly two years.

The anteater is known for its long nose. Anteaters have elongated snouts that house their long, sticky tongues, which they use to capture ants and termites. These unique adaptations make them highly specialized feeders in their habitats, which range from grasslands to rainforests in Central and South America.

Monkeys are often seen in circuses, where they perform tricks and entertain audiences with their playful antics. These intelligent and social animals are trained to perform a variety of acts, such as riding bicycles, balancing on balls, and interacting with other animals. While some circuses have phased out the use of animals in their shows, monkeys have historically been a common feature in circus performances.
